duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist radiologists and technologists with patient care and maintenance of departmental inventory and equipment.
Administer oral contrast material to outpatients and walk them to the patient changing area.
Practice aseptic techniques and strictly obey isolation and infection control procedures.
Assist in utilization of PACS, RIS, and HIS systems.
Take part in in-service programs for the staff and report any changes in patient's condition or behavior to technical or nursing personnel.
Provide direction to families, visitors, and patients in a courteous and positive manner and maintain and respect confidentiality.
Incorporate physiological and developmental age of patients into the overall plan for the delivery of care.

Work effectively as a member of a multidisciplinary team and perform the physical requirements of the job, including standing, walking, reaching, climbing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, and/or crouching.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or equivalent. Successful completion of one year of an Associate's of Science in Radiography program. American Heart Association Basic Life Support Certification.
